security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with standard PDF processing functionality. All scripts perform local file operations using established Python libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, pdf2image, PIL). No network access, shell command execution, or environment variable access detected. The code follows safe patterns for file I/O and JSON parsing.

content.user_title: Extract, fill, merge, and create PDF documents
content.value_statement: Working with PDFs manually wastes time and causes errors. This skill automates PDF text extraction, form filling, merging, splitting, and creation with Python scripts.
actual_capabilities: Extract text and tables from PDF files using pdfplumber
Fill both fillable and non-fillable PDF forms automatically
Merge multiple PDFs into a single document
Split PDFs into individual pages or page ranges
Convert PDF pages to PNG images for visual analysis
Validate form field bounding boxes before filling
limitations: Requires Python libraries like pypdf, pdfplumber, and pdf2image to be installed
OCR for scanned PDFs requires additional pytesseract setup
Some PDF viewers may display filled forms differently
Password-protected PDFs require the password to process

best_practices: Always check if a PDF has fillable fields before attempting form operations
Convert PDFs to images first when working with non-fillable forms to see field locations
Validate bounding boxes with the check script before generating the final filled PDF
anti_patterns: Do not skip the validation step when filling non-fillable forms with annotations
Avoid processing encrypted PDFs without first providing the correct password
Do not assume all PDF viewers will render filled forms identically

faq.question: What Python libraries do I need to install?
faq.answer: Install pypdf, pdfplumber, pdf2image, and Pillow. For OCR features, also install pytesseract.

faq.question: Can this skill fill PDF forms that are just scanned images?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the non-fillable form workflow to add text annotations at specific coordinates on the page.

faq.question: How do I handle PDFs with password protection?
faq.answer: Use pypdf decrypt method with the password before processing. See the reference documentation for examples.

faq.question: Can I extract tables from PDFs into Excel format?
faq.answer: Yes. Use pdfplumber to extract tables as lists, convert to pandas DataFrames, then export to Excel.

faq.question: Why does my filled form look different in various PDF readers?
faq.answer: PDF readers interpret form annotations differently. The skill sets NeedAppearances flag to improve compatibility.

faq.question: How do I merge specific pages from multiple PDFs?
faq.answer: Use pypdf PdfWriter to selectively copy pages from multiple PdfReader objects into a new combined document.
